intro: Chaetanthera linearis var. linearis, commonly known as the slender chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open woodland and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its linear, slender leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers make it visually distinct. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
